title: Chocolate CREAM PIE'D
body_text:
CXXX9: LETSCHE vs. VETRANO
Cousins Collide -
CREAMation
Style!
Flash Results by Game
... Letsche: 1, 2, 4; Vetrano: 3, 5
What do you think of these magnificent athletes, each taking it to their absolute physical limits to keep their captain free from public embarrassment?!
The bad "blood" was all too prevalent between this pair of cousins, leading to this eagerly-anticipated confrontation. Add in the 2007
New CONCEPT of the Year
stipulation, and you've got a collision of epic proportions.
"Killer" Kerr, "Maniac" Mills, "The UnSTOPAble One", "The Crazy One" were all present. Pierce, K. Adams, DiBuccio, Megill? Just another day in the office for these respected veterans. And much praise to the newbies of this 139th spectacular - well done.
The Rules
: Classic two-team match-up.
The Match
: In a possible preview of next week's "Family Affair", Ryan Letsche defeated his cousin Bobby Vetrano, 3 - 2, in the 7th
CREAMation Rules
match.
Captain Statistics
: Letsche 4-5-0 / Vetrano 0-2-0. Letsche became the first player in history to win two
CREAMation Rules
encounters (see
DODGEBALL 125
). He's only the third competitor [along with V. Winston and Tronolone] to partake in two as well.
Moments & Stars
: the Game 1 "last man standing" showdown between captains Letsche and Vetrano; Steve Pham's incredible double catch; Melissa Kerr sagging; Mike Edwards in a purple pimp costume
Attendance
: 22 competitors, comprised of 18 men and 4 women
New Players
: Justin McCurdy, Cris Belfer, Andrew Feiter
Other Notes
: Season 14 is the first ten-week program to feature two separate
CREAMation Rules
contests, the first of these in late-March at
DODGEBALL 131
. This was also the first
CREAMation
to feature chocolate whipped-cream. Music for the event was provided by Captain Letsche's iPod.
A Message from "The Writer"
"How could I possibly ever disappoint you people? Sure you'd never be able to recognize me on the street, but I do care. I hope you thoroughly enjoyed DODGEBALL CXXX9 and a special thanks to both Bobby Vetrano and Ryan Letsche for having the brass to participate in a contest of this kind. To CXL we go!"
________________________________________
_______
COMING UP NEXT ...
